comment._content: Seems unlikely this could have been taken 1910-1915--Norma Shearer was born in 1902: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Norma_Shearer

comment.author: 66733752@N00
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/11418107@N02] I thought the same thing. Her outfit is definitely "Roaring 20's".

comment.author: 43854658@N00
comment._content:
This Bain Collection / LOC photograph appears in five non-English versions of Wikipedia. Those versions list the date as 1927, and reference the date on the negative "in reverse, upper left corner". It very likely could be "August, 1927" [ 8 / 19.27 ]. I have posted an inverted (reversed) version of this photo, below, such that others can have a look for themselves to try to determine the date. I also tried to read the writing on the negative, along the right-hand side of the negative (also in reverse). I'm not sure if the word, "sport" is accurate — perhaps another viewer will have a better read on it. (This can be read on the same "inverted" version below.)
"Red + white sport       White hat + pumps       Hanging white pearl"
  Inverted image:

comment.author: 43854658@N00
comment._content: @ pennylrichardsca —  I initially thought of "skirt", and it would fit the context, but the word looks nothing like "skirt".
